Summary: CMS Energy analyzed 2 bills with 9 direct and 5 indirect impacts. Key effects include minor subsidy changes. Direct risk is high; indirect risk is neutral. Overall risk: moderate.
SummaryKeypoints: H.R. 1 - One Big Beautiful Bill Act imposes regulation. affecting operations in United States. with long-term implementation The legislation states: "This section shall not apply to any wind energy component produced and sold after December 31, 2027."

H.R. 5376 - Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 provides $0.07 in subsidy. affecting operations in United States. with long-term implementation The legislation states: "in the case of a residential inverter, 6.5 cents"

H.R. 5376 - Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 provides $0.11 in subsidy. affecting operations in United States. with long-term implementation The legislation states: "in the case of a microinverter or a distributed wind inverter, 11 cents"
H.R. 5376 - Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 provides $0.02 in subsidy. affecting operations in United States. with long-term implementation The legislation states: "in the case of a blade, 2 cents"
H.R. 5376 - Inflation Reduction Act of 2022 provides $0.05 in subsidy. affecting operations in United States. with long-term implementation The legislation states: "in the case of a nacelle, 5 cents"
